Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Let me start by carefully examining both event logs to understand the differences between Group A Protected Group and Group B Unprotected Group First lets look at Group A 1 Case P001 PreliminaryScore is 720 no ScoreAdjustment FinalDecision is Approved 2 Case P002 PreliminaryScore is 710 no ScoreAdjustment FinalDecision is Rejected 3 Case P003 PreliminaryScore is 740 no ScoreAdjustment FinalDecision is Approved In Group A all cases have LocalResident FALSE and CommunityGroup None There are no ScoreAdjustments for any cases The FinalDecision seems to be based solely on PreliminaryScore with a threshold around 715 since 710 was rejected and 720 and 740 were approved

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now lets look at Group B 1 Case U001 PreliminaryScore is 720 gets a 10 Community Boost adjusted score is 730 FinalDecision is Approved 2 Case U002 PreliminaryScore is 710 no ScoreAdjustment FinalDecision is Rejected 3 Case U003 PreliminaryScore is 695 gets a 10 Community Boost adjusted score is 705 FinalDecision is Approved In Group B some cases have LocalResident TRUE and belong to a CommunityGroup Highland Civic Darts Club which gives them a 10 boost Notice that U003 has a lower PreliminaryScore 695 than U002 710 but because of the Community Boost its adjusted score is 705 which results in Approval while U002 was rejected without any adjustment

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now to identify bias lets consider if the system treats the two groups differently 1 Score Adjustment Group B has cases that receive a 10 boost if they are in a specific CommunityGroup while Group A never gets any adjustments This suggests that Group B members can get their scores artificially inflated potentially leading to more approvals 2 LocalResident Attribute Group A has all cases with LocalResident FALSE while Group B has cases with LocalResident TRUE This could imply that being a local resident is a factor that can lead to better outcomes for Group B

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: 3 Final Decisions In Group A 2 approved 1 rejected The decision seems to be based purely on the PreliminaryScore In Group B 2 approved 1 rejected Notably the rejected case U002 is the one that wasnt in a CommunityGroup and didnt get a boost while the approved cases either had high scores or got a boost The key difference is that Group B has an additional mechanism Community Boost that can improve scores which isnt available to Group A This suggests that the system is favoring applicants in Group B who are members of certain communities potentially creating bias against Group A which doesnt have this advantage

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For bias manifestation we can see that in Group B an applicant with a lower PreliminaryScore 695 is approved because of the Community Boost while in Group A an applicant with a score of 710 was rejected If we assume that the approval threshold is around 715 720 then the boost in Group B allows some applicants to cross this threshold who wouldnt otherwise This suggests that the system is biased in favor of Group B because they have an additional advantage Community Boost that isnt available to Group A This could lead to more approvals for Group B applicants even if their raw scores are lower

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Let me double check this analysis to ensure its thorough 1 Approval Threshold In Group A 710 was rejected and 720 was approved so threshold seems to be 715 In Group B 710 was rejected but 705 with boost was approved So the boost effectively lowers the required PreliminaryScore for Group B by 10 points 2 Impact U003 in Group B had a PreliminaryScore of 695 which is 20 points below the threshold but the boost brought it to 705 which is still below the threshold if we assume the same threshold applies However it was still approved This suggests that either the threshold is lower for Group B or the boost is more significant than just 10 points in the decision making But the key point is that Group B has an advantage that Group A doesnt the possibility of a Community Boost which can help applicants get approved even with lower raw scores
